content:
# I successfully extracted 5 iron plates from the furnace, bringing my total inventory to 9 iron plates. The furnace now has 1 remaining iron ore.

# To maximize efficiency, I can either smelt the remaining iron ore into plates or use it for crafting. 
# Since I have enough iron plates for now, I will choose to smelt the last iron ore to convert it into another iron plate.

# I will insert the remaining iron ore and coal into the furnace for smelting.
insert_item(Prototype.Coal, new_furnace, quantity=1)  # Insert 1 coal into the furnace for fuel
insert_item(Prototype.IronOre, new_furnace, quantity=1)  # Insert the last iron ore into the furnace for smelting

# Let’s check the furnace status to ensure everything is set up correctly for the smelting process.
print(f"New Furnace status after adding last resources: {inspect_inventory(new_furnace)}")  # Check the contents of the new furnace

# Now I will wait for the last iron ore to smelt into an iron plate.
for _ in range(30):  # Maximum 30 seconds wait
    if inspect_inventory(new_furnace)[Prototype.IronPlate] >= 1:  # Wait until at least 1 iron plate has been produced
        break
    sleep(1)
else:
    raise Exception("Smelting timeout - check fuel and inputs")

# After the wait, I can extract the iron plate from the furnace.
crafted_plate = extract_item(Prototype.IronPlate, new_furnace.position, quantity=1)  # Extract the produced iron plate
print(f"Extracted Iron Plate from new furnace: {crafted_plate}")
print(f"Final Furnace status after extraction: {inspect_inventory(new_furnace)}")  # Check the furnace status after extraction
print(f"Final Inventory after extraction: {inspect_inventory()}")  # Confirm total iron plates in the inventory after extraction
